subject: RE: [junit] Junit and JDK 1.4.2
msgSnippet: Actually, I just looked at that shell script and there seems to be a mistake in it.  The find command should have an asterisk before the word java (change
messageBody:
Actually, I just looked at that shell script and there seems to be a
mistake in it. The 'find' command should have an asterisk before the
word java (change 'java' to '*java').

--
=jason rogers
[:everyQuestion | ^Jesus]

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jacaetevha@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, November 05, 2003 10:48 PM
> To: JUnit Yahoo Group
> Subject: Re: [junit] Junit and JDK 1.4.2
>
>
> On Thu, 04 Sep 2003 19:00:53 +0530, "Ranjeet Sahay"
> <rsahay@...>
> said:
> > Hi,
> >
> > Working on JUnit on JDK 1.4.2 it gives certain warning
> about assert
> > methods. I know this method has been introduced from
> JDK1.4 onwards.
> > Should they affect my JUnit assertion in anyway?
>
> Ranjeet,
>
> I believe this question is a FAQ... The answer is to use
> assertTrue(...) instead of assert(...). There is a shell
> script (which can also be run in Cygwin if you are a
> Windows user) at http://scgwiki.iam.unibe.ch:8080/SCG/385
> that will convert your files for you.
>
> --
> =jason
> [:question | ^One]
